definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: However, she was unsuccessful and came back broke.
sentences.chinese: 但是她並沒有成功，一文不名的鎩羽而歸。

sentences.english: The only people who say money does not happiness are the pathetic broke individuals who do not have it.
sentences.chinese: 而只有那些一文不名的窮光蛋纔會說有錢並不幸福。

sentences.english: A beggar is no different than you or me, ' cept he ain' t got no money.
sentences.chinese: 乞丐和你我沒有不同，除了他們一文不名之外。

definition: without a penny to one's name/penniless/stony-broke
not having anything at all (idiom); utterly lacking/without two sticks to rub together
poor wretch/pauper/destitute man/poverty-stricken peasant/penniless good-for-nothing/impecunious vagabond
down and out/in dire straits/unrestrained/unconventional/also pr. [luo4 tuo4]
to possess nothing except bare necessities/to live a poor or frugal life
having wealth equivalent to that of an entire nation (idiom)/extremely wealthy
